ticket_details.description:
Normalized Requirements:
1) Automatic generation of Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM)
   This capability shall automatically generate a Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM) for each test plan to ...
ticket_details.explanation: This ticket has inferred requirements only. No explicit, numbered requirements were found in the ticket content.
ticket_details.summary: Add Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM) Generation for Test Plans

api_tests.expected_result: System automatically performs: Add Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM) Generation for Test Plans
steps: Create a test plan containing at least one requirement and one test case.
Allow the system to complete test plan generation.
Verify that a Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM) is generated automatically.
Verify the RTM contains exactly one entry per requirement.
Verify each RTM entry includes requirement ID, description, associated test case IDs, and coverage status.
api_tests.title: System-level happy path: Add Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM) Generation for Test Plans

data_validation_tests.expected_result: RTM JSON contains requirement_id, requirement_description, coverage_status, and covered_by_tests fields for each requirement; each requirement_id appears exactly once (uniqueness check: count distinct requirement_id values equals input requirement count)
steps: Generate test plan with 5 requirements
Call GET /api/v1/runs/{run_id}/rtm or download RTM JSON from /export/rtm endpoint
Parse RTM JSON response
Verify each RTM row contains requirement_id field with non-empty string value
Verify each RTM row contains requirement_description field with non-empty string value
Verify each RTM row contains coverage_status field with value 'COVERED' or 'NOT_COVERED'
Verify each RTM row contains covered_by_tests field (array type)
Count distinct requirement_id values in RTM
Verify count equals 5 (each requirement appears exactly once)
data_validation_tests.title: Data Validation: RTM schema integrity for ATA-36-REQ-001

edge_cases.expected_result: Test plan creation completes within 5 seconds; RTM becomes available within 30 seconds as indicated by GET /api/v1/runs/{run_id}/status returning rtm_status field equals 'completed'
steps: Create test plan with 50 requirements
Submit POST /generate-test-plan request and record start time
Verify HTTP 200 response is received within 5 seconds (test plan creation is non-blocking)
Extract run_id from response
Poll GET /api/v1/runs/{run_id}/status endpoint every 2 seconds
Verify rtm_status field changes to 'completed' within 30 seconds of test plan creation
edge_cases.title: Resilience: Non-blocking RTM generation for ATA-36-REQ-001

negative_tests.expected_result: System returns HTTP 400 error with error message containing 'requirement_id' or 'invalid requirement'; test plan creation fails; no RTM artifact is generated
steps: Create test plan with missing requirement_id field in one requirement object
Submit POST /generate-test-plan request with invalid requirement data
Verify system returns HTTP 400 error status code
Verify error response body contains 'requirement_id' or 'invalid requirement' in error message
Verify test plan creation fails and no RTM is generated
negative_tests.title: Negative: RTM generation failure handling for ATA-36-REQ-001

ticket_item_coverage.text: Automatic generation of Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM)
Ensuring each requirement appears once in RTM
Inclusion of Requirement ID in RTM
Non-blocking RTM generation for test plan creation
Inclusion of associated test case ID(s) in RTM
Inclusion of coverage status in RTM
Deriving RTM directly from test plan
Inclusion of Requirement description in RTM
Manual input of requirements into RTM
Editing test cases against requirements within Jira
Potential misalignment between RTM entries and actual test cases if requirements are not accurately captured.
